page.title: 04Industry
page.content: Although our docks have fallen into disuse, the deep water habour employs 160 people. The 100,000 ton ships that come into the harbour bring coal and iron ore and other materials for the steel works. Most of the working men in Port Talbot work in the steel works. On the moors at Baglan there is the J.R.Freeman cigar factory and about 1,100 work there. Then to the north-west of our area is a big chemical works called B.P.Baglan Bay where about 500 people work. A new industrial park on Baglan Moors is going to take up 146 acres. The M4 motorway and railway adjoin on the north side. In the south-east of our area are some engineering works, many of which rely on the British Steel Corporation for their work.
